revised_title: Observations on the Markings of the Eel-Back Dun Variety of the Horse
tldr: The author examines the markings of the Eel-back Dun variety of horses in Scotland and questions the conclusions drawn in a previous paper by the late Earl of Morton. He suggests that the peculiar markings may be inherited from a common ancestor and that the cross bar markings on the legs are found in zebras, not quaggas, which are distinct species.
